items.title: ‘Friendly Signs’ Documentary Follows One Man’s Quest to Create Community for Deaf Prisoners
items.description: Director Rahsaan “New York” Thomas explores the impact of Tommy Wickerd’s sign language class at San Quentin and the challenges of prison filmmaking.

items.title: Under Pressure, Cuyahoga County Releases Video of Teen’s Shooting by Deputy
items.description: After four months, the county provided body cam footage, and is weighing policy changes amid a Marshall Project and News 5 Cleveland investigation.

items.title: Why This Physician Testifies in Favor of the Firing Squad
items.description: James Williams is an ER doctor, a hunter, a gunshot victim — and the go-to expert for death row prisoners seeking an alternative to lethal injection.

items.title: How the U.S. Turned Away From the Death Penalty and Toward ‘Death by Incarceration’
items.description: The number of people imprisoned for life continues to climb, even as the overall prison population declines.

items.title: Journalists: How to Report on Deaths in Jails and Prisons
items.description: When you get a tip about a death or multiple deaths in your local jail or prison, there are concrete steps you can take to start investigating.
